00032 // Class for array variables. The dimensions of the array are stored in the
00033 // list SHAPE. 
00034 //
00035 // jhrg 9/6/94
00036 
00037 #ifndef _array_h
00038 #define _array_h 1
00039 
00040 #ifndef __POWERPC__
00041 #ifdef __GNUG__
00042 #pragma interface
00043 #endif
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 #include <string>
00047 
00048 #include <vector>
00049 
00050 #ifndef _dods_limits_h
00051 #include "dods-limits.h"
00052 #endif

00054 #ifndef _vector_h
00055 #include "Vector.h"
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 const int DODS_MAX_ARRAY = DODS_INT_MAX;
00059 
00103 class Array: public Vector {
00104 public:
00115     struct dimension {
00116     int size;       
00117     string name;        
00118     int start;      
00119     int stop;       
00120     int stride;     
00121     int c_size;     
00122     bool selected;      
00123     };
00124 
00125 private:
00126     std::vector<dimension> _shape;  // list of dimensions (i.e., the shape)
00127 
00128     unsigned int print_array(ostream &os, unsigned int index, 
00129                  unsigned int dims, unsigned int shape[]);
00130     unsigned int print_array(FILE *out, unsigned int index, 
00131                  unsigned int dims, unsigned int shape[]);
00132                  
00133 protected:
00134     void _duplicate(const Array &a);
00135     
00136 public:
00142     typedef std::vector<dimension>::const_iterator Dim_citer ;
00149     typedef std::vector<dimension>::iterator Dim_iter ;
00150 
00151     Array(const string &n = "", BaseType *v = 0);
00152     Array(const Array &rhs);
00153     virtual ~Array();
00154 
00155     Array &operator=(const Array &rhs);
00156     virtual BaseType *ptr_duplicate();
00157 
00158     void update_length(int size);
00159 
00160     void append_dim(int size, string name = "");
00161 
00162     void add_constraint(Dim_iter &i, int start, int stride, int stop);
00163 
00164     void add_constraint(Pix p, int start, int stride, int stop);
00165 
00166     void reset_constraint();
00167 
00168     void clear_constraint();
00169 
00170     Pix first_dim();
00171 
00172     void next_dim(Pix p);
00173 
00174     Dim_iter dim_begin() ;
00175 
00176     Dim_iter dim_end() ;
00177 
00178     int dimension_size(Pix p, bool constrained = false);
00179     int dimension_size(Dim_iter &i, bool constrained = false);
00180 
00181     int dimension_start(Pix p, bool constrained = false);
00182 
00183     int dimension_start(Dim_iter &i, bool constrained = false);
00184 
00185     int dimension_stop(Pix p, bool constrained = false);
00186 
00187     int dimension_stop(Dim_iter &i, bool constrained = false);
00188 
00189     int dimension_stride(Pix p, bool constrained = false);
00190 
00191     int dimension_stride(Dim_iter &i, bool constrained = false);
00192 
00193     string dimension_name(Pix p);
00194 
00195     string dimension_name(Dim_iter &i);
00196 
00197     unsigned int dimensions(bool constrained = false);
00198 
00199     virtual void print_decl(ostream &os, string space = "    ",
00200                 bool print_semi = true,
00201                 bool constraint_info = false,
00202                 bool constrained = false);
00203 
00204     virtual void print_decl(FILE *out, string space = "    ",
00205                 bool print_semi = true,
00206                 bool constraint_info = false,
00207                 bool constrained = false);
00208 
00209     virtual void print_val(ostream &os, string space = "", 
00210                bool print_decl_p = true);
00211 
00212     virtual void print_val(FILE *out, string space = "", 
00213                bool print_decl_p = true);
00214 
00215     virtual bool check_semantics(string &msg, bool all = false);
00216 };

00274  * redefine Pix to be an IteratorAdapter. Usage remains the same and all code
00275  * outside of the DAP should compile and link with no problems. Added methods
00276  * to the different classes where Pix is used to include methods to use STL
00277  * iterators. Replaced the use of Pix within the DAP to use iterators instead.

00303  * Added the Constructor class which is to Structures, Sequences and Grids
00304  * what Vector is to Arrays and Lists. This should be used in future
00305  * refactorings (I thought it was going to be used for the back pointers).
00306  * Introduced back pointers so children can refer to their parents in
00307  * hierarchies of variables.
00308  * Added to Sequence methods to tell if a child sequence is done
00309  * deserializing its data.
00310  * Fixed the operator=() and copy ctors; removed redundency from
00311  * _duplicate().
00312  * Changed the way serialize and deserialize work for sequences. Now SOI and
00313  * EOS markers are written for every `level' of a nested Sequence. This
00314  * should fixed nested Sequences. There is still considerable work to do
00315  * for these to work in all cases.

00320  * wrapped headers included in other headers in those guard symbols (to cut
00321  * down on extraneous file processing - See Lakos).
00322  *
00323  * Revision 1.47  2000/09/21 16:22:07  jimg
00324  * Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00325  * Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00326  * two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00327  * InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00328  * the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00329  * is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.

00467  * Revision 1.14  1995/03/04  14:34:53  jimg
00468  * Major modifications to the transmission and representation of values:
00469  * Added card() virtual function which is true for classes that
00470  * contain cardinal types (byte, int float, string).
00471  * Changed the representation of Str from the C rep to a C++
00472  * class represenation.
00473  * Chnaged read_val and store_val so that they take and return
00474  * types that are stored by the object (e.g., inthe case of Str
00475  * an URL, read_val returns a C++ String object).
00476  * Modified Array representations so that arrays of card()
00477  * objects are just that - no more storing strings, ... as
00478  * C would store them.
00479  * Arrays of non cardinal types are arrays of the DODS objects (e.g.,
00480  * an array of a structure is represented as an array of Structure
00481  * objects).
00482  *
00483  * Revision 1.13  1995/02/10  02:22:53  jimg
00484  * Added DBMALLOC includes and switch to code which uses malloc/free.
00485  * Private and protected symbols now start with `_'.
00486  * Added new accessors for name and type fields of BaseType; the old ones
00487  * will be removed in a future release.
00488  * Added the store_val() mfunc. It stores the given value in the object's
00489  * internal buffer.
00490  * Made both List and Str handle their values via pointers to memory.
00491  * Fixed read_val().
00492  * Made serialize/deserialize handle all malloc/free calls (even in those
00493  * cases where xdr initiates the allocation).
00494  * Fixed print_val().
